page.title: 09RELIGION (1)
page.content: The church building in our block belongs to the Free Church It was built in 1898 when the Free Church broke away from the established church. Most of the people of Hilton joined the Free Church and the Ashvale Rd was much used as was all the other rights of way to the church in the middle of the parish. It was built to seat about 800 but by 1979 the numbers attending were so small that maintaining and heating the building was difficult. Also the distribution of the congregation had changed with the great bulk now in the Seaboard villages. A small building was erected in Hilton in 1979 with seating for about 120. Until recently the Church of Scotland, the Free Church, the United Free and the Free Presbyterian church were the only denominations but now there are great changes
